world

Class SimpleWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • world.SimpleWorld
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, Pinterface

    public class SimpleWorld
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements Pinterface
    Holds the camera and interfaces with the projector which controls the frame rate. Also holds logic for starting the game along with rendering the frame.
    Author:
    Brian Nakayama
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleWorld

        public SimpleWorld(SimpleMap m,
           int width,
           int height,
           java.lang.String title)
        Create a SimpleWorld with the desired width and height.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to be rendered and updated. Switch the map to switch "environments" or "rooms".
        width - The desired width in pixels.
        height - The desired height in pixels.
        title - The title of the application.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(boolean fullscreen)
        Starts the loop that runs the game and updates the objects. Essentially starts the game.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - True for fullscreen, false for windowed screen. The windowed screen will be the size defined in the constructor in pixels.

      • setSimpleSolidMap

        public void setSimpleSolidMap(SimpleMap m)
        Set the current map held and rendered by the world.
        Parameters:
        m - The current map.

      • getSimpleSolidMap

        public SimpleMap getSimpleSolidMap()
        Get the current map held and rendered by the world.
        Returns:
        The current map.

      • setSimpleWorldObject

        public void setSimpleWorldObject(SimpleWorldObject swo)
        Set the world object which can draw and render over the rest of the screen.
        Parameters:
        swo - The SimpleWorldObject for this world.
        See Also:
        SimpleWorldObject

      • getSimpleWorldObject

        public SimpleWorldObject getSimpleWorldObject()
        Get the world object.
        Returns:
        The SimpleWorldObject for this world.
        See Also:
        SimpleWorldObject

      • setCameraStalk

        public void setCameraStalk(SimpleObject cameraStalk)
        Set an object for the camera to follow (stalk). Notice that the camera will only have an effect if the screen is smaller than the size of the world.
        Parameters:
        cameraStalk - The object to follow.

      • setBGImage

        public void setBGImage(java.lang.String sprite)
        Set the background image to be tiled. Not the suggested way to load the background. It should be statically loaded. Then use setBGImage(Img).
        Parameters:
        sprite - The path to the backgroun image to be tiled.

      • setBGImage

        public void setBGImage(int rgba,
              int width,
              int height)
        Set the background image to be tiled. This method sets a colorImage to be tiled.
        Parameters:
        rgba - The 32 bit color for the background.
        width - The width in pixels of the image.
        height - The height in pixels of the image.
        See Also:
        ColorImg

      • setBGImage

        public void setBGImage(Img i)
        Set the background image to be tiled. This method sets an arbitrary image to be tiled. This will work strangely with animations.
        Parameters:
        i - The image to be tiled.

      • setCamera

        public void setCamera(int x,
             int y)
        Set the x and y coordinate of the camera for the top left of the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x coordinate.
        y - The new y coordinate.

      • getCamera

        public int[] getCamera()
        Get the array that holds the x and y coordinate of the camera.
        Returns:
        a 2d array with the x and y coordinate of the camera.

      • getProjector

        public Projector getProjector()
        Get the projector created by the SimpleWorld. The Projector holds more methods for starting and stopping the animation thread. For example you may want to change the FPS, or render more than one copy of the screen.
        Returns:
        The projector

      • iUpdate

        public void iUpdate(java.awt.image.BufferedImage ISlide)
        Inherited method, not for intended for direct use. This method updates the camera, all the objects, then paints them all.
        Specified by:
        iUpdate in interface Pinterface
        See Also:
        Pinterface.iUpdate(java.awt.image.BufferedImage)
